site_name: 186 Red Lion RoadTolworthSurbitonKT6 7QZ
description: Erection of hip to gable and rear dormer roof extensions with chimney stack removal and installation of 2no front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion
decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, any new windows or rooflights at first floor level or above in the flank elevation shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with and permanently retained in obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable, tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 9 (Waste and Recycling Facilities), Condition 10 (Cycle Parking Facility) and Condition 12 ( Scheme of Investigation) of planning permission 21/00418/FUL are hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.
